Jake Sully.Action: Pushes forward in his wheelchair through a crowded city street despite physical limitations, showing determination and adaptability.
Reflects on his situation with a realistic understanding of his medical and financial limitations.
Appears passive and resigned to his confined living conditions, showing limited initiative to change his circumstances.
Watches a man abuse a woman in a bar and does not look away, starts to move his wheelchair toward the situation.
Balances a chair on two wheels while holding a tequila shot on his forehead, entertaining onlookers including other disabled vets.
Expresses a hardened, cynical worldview about the world being cold and unfair, and that the strong prey on the weak.
Balances a chair on two wheels while holding a tequila shot on his forehead, impressing onlookers.
Struggles laboriously to remove his pants due to atrophied legs.
Observes abuse in the bar and chooses to not look away, then starts pushing his wheelchair forward, implying intent to act.
Intervenes physically to stop a bully, showing willingness to defend others.
Calls the bouncer a 'candy ass bitch' after being thrown out, showing hostility and insult.
Shouts jauntily to no one in particular despite being hurt and alone, showing resilience and a friendly, lighthearted attitude.
Leaps from wheelchair and physically overpowers a bully, showing physical capability and fighting spirit.
Despite being thrown out and injured, remains defiant and ready to fight, demonstrating resilience and mental toughness.
Mocks and taunts his adversaries even when vulnerable, showing confidence but potentially poor judgment in escalating conflict.
Lies sprawled in the rain, seemingly passive and exposed after the fight, which could indicate a momentary lapse in control or strategic thinking.
Expresses sorrow and respect upon seeing his deceased brother's face and reflects on his brother's ambitions.
Mentions being sent somewhere he would regret, showing a resigned and somewhat bitter attitude.
Reflects on his brother's death and his own perceived lack of skills compared to his brother, showing self-awareness but low confidence in competence.
Stares down at his own face in the crematorium, showing emotional impact but no immediate action or problem-solving.
Pushes away from his capsule and glides to the lockers despite paralyzed legs, adapting to zero gravity.
Struggles to put on exopack breathing gear while others do so easily.
Rolls down the ramp in his wheelchair, aware of others' mocking remarks but does not respond aggressively.
Struggles to put on his exopack breathing gear while others do so with practiced moves.
Observes his surroundings carefully while rolling down the ramp, noticing arrows stuck in the tractor tires.
Uses a crude insult ('limpdicks') toward Wainfleet and Fike as he approaches.
Rolls confidently through a heavily armed and dangerous perimeter in his wheelchair, showing no hesitation despite the hostile environment.
Uses casual, somewhat confrontational language ('limpdicks') when addressing Wainfleet and Fike, indicating confidence but possibly poor social tact.
Fails to react defensively or take evasive action when the aerial predator attacks him, relying on others to neutralize the threat.
Rolls in late and watches the security briefing passively from the back without engaging or showing initiative.
Pays close attention to Colonel Quaritch's briefing about the dangers and procedures on Pandora, indicating awareness and mental preparation.
Shakes Norm's hand and engages in polite conversation despite being wary.
Responds briefly and somewhat reservedly to Norm's comments about his brother.
Shakes hands with Norm and engages in conversation despite being wary, showing social adaptability and willingness to connect.
Rolls his wheelchair confidently through the corridor, indicating physical capability and self-assurance in a new environment.
Responds briefly and somewhat reservedly to Norm's comments, showing cautiousness but not disengagement.
Appears drawn toward the amnio tank and the avatar figure, indicating curiosity and focus on the task at hand.
Mesmerized as he stares at his avatar, showing curiosity and openness.
Speaks casually and sincerely in videologs, showing a friendly and genuine demeanor.
Shows curiosity and attentiveness by observing his avatar and asking questions about the process.
Admits inexperience by saying 'Never been in a lab before.'
Follows instructions to document observations and feelings as part of scientific procedure.
Waits patiently while Norm and Grace converse in Na'vi, despite being ignored.
Acknowledges his brother's death calmly and sincerely when Grace dismisses him.
Waits patiently while others speak in Na'vi and ignores him, showing some passivity and lack of immediate engagement.
Clearly and confidently states that his brother is dead, addressing the situation honestly and directly.
Admits to lack of lab training honestly and without pretense.
Does not attempt to argue or boast about his qualifications when challenged.
Admits to having no lab training and only minimal high school chemistry knowledge, which he ditched.
Maintains composure despite being criticized and dismissed by Grace and Max.
Glances through the pressure window at his Avatar lying on the gurney, preparing for the link process.
Refuses Grace's help, insisting 'I got this' while hauling himself into the link chair despite difficulty.
Meets Grace's questioning with a defiant glare and a sarcastic remark, showing resistance rather than openness.
Hauls himself into the link chair without assistance despite physical difficulty.
Has only logged about an hour of link time compared to Norm's 520 hours.
Shows defiance and determination in face of lack of training and hostile environment.
Laughs and grins at Max after accidentally knocking over instruments, showing a playful and good-natured reaction.
Yanks off bio-monitor wires and pushes past med techs despite their protests, showing disregard for their instructions and authority.
Successfully transitions into his avatar body, stands up, and explores his new form with curiosity and confidence.
Ignores instructions to take it slow and undergo tests, yanks off bio-monitor wires, and pushes past med techs.
Joyfully runs and revels in the alien environment, showing openness and appreciation for new experiences.
Responds to Grace's teasing with recognition and engagement, indicating friendly rapport.
Flexes legs, jumps, lands a little unsteadily but joyful; takes a few steps and breaks into a run, showing eagerness and physical capability.
Does not respond to people calling him while running, indicating possible lack of situational awareness or focus on his own experience.
Sits quietly and observes the environment, showing awareness of surroundings and adapting to the new setting.
Comments on the strange sensation of his queue moving, indicating curiosity and attention to detail.
Closes his eyes and rests after a long day, showing ability to manage fatigue and maintain composure.
No direct action taken during the squad's forest operation; remains passive in this excerpt.
Accepts Trudy's request to man a door gun without hesitation and shares a friendly fist bump.
Isolated from conversations around him, showing some social distance.
Accepts the door gunner position without hesitation and confidently interacts with Trudy.
Struggles with the dead weight of his legs as he hauls himself out of the unit.
Shows readiness to engage with the new environment and equipment, follows Quaritch to try the AMPSUIT.
Responds to Quaritch's praise with a casual, somewhat dismissive comment ('just another hellhole').
Nods and agrees to Quaritch's plan to gain the trust of the Na'vi, showing willingness to cooperate and follow orders.
Expresses respect and admiration for Quaritch's strength and determination.
Engages in casual conversation with Grace and Norm, indicating friendly social interaction.
Nods confidently to Quaritch's orders and accepts the mission to learn about the natives and gain their trust, showing readiness to follow complex instructions.
Engages in conversation with Grace and Norm, indicating social adaptability and situational awareness.
Acknowledges Grace's instructions and the importance of respecting the Na'vi culture.
Makes a sarcastic remark about being skinned and made into a drum.
Acknowledges Grace's instructions and prepares to link into his avatar despite uncertainty.
Makes a sarcastic comment about being skinned and made into a drum, showing skepticism but also awareness of danger.
Mans the door gun confidently, feet propped on the skids while flying over dangerous terrain.
Grins into the airstream, showing ease and comfort in a high-stress environment.
Pulls the massive door gun off its mount and hefts it like an assault rifle, demonstrating physical capability and readiness.
He and Wainfleet leap out to secure the LZ, scanning the tree-line warily, weapons aimed.
Jake takes point as they enter the jungle, moving through the foliage hyper-alert but visibly tense and nervous, white-knuckling his rifle.
Looks behind him feeling unseen eyes, showing awareness and caution.
Explores the school ruins quietly, touching the blackboard with bullet holes, showing curiosity and respect for the place.
Watches Grace as she turns away sharply, but does not respond negatively or confrontationally.
Looks behind him feeling unseen eyes, cautiously aware of surroundings.
Explores the school ruins carefully, noticing details like bullet holes and stingbats.
Jams equipment into his pack after being sharply told to help with gear, showing some compliance but no initiative.
Raises his rifle at the hammerhead titanothere, showing readiness to shoot.
Stops and listens to Grace's advice, begins to back away instead of shooting.
Curiously investigates the spiral plants, triggering a chain reaction that reveals a large creature; raises his rifle instinctively but listens to Grace's advice to not shoot and to hold his ground.
Initially reacts with impatience and boredom, scouting ahead without full awareness of potential dangers.
Asks for guidance when unsure what to do facing the hammerhead titanothere, showing willingness to learn and adapt.
Screams and runs straight at the charging hammerhead to protect others.
Uses confident and aggressive language ('That's what I'm talkin' about, bitch!') during a dangerous situation.
Screams and runs straight at the charging hammerhead, successfully intimidating it to stop and flee.
Unaware of the approaching thanator behind him, showing a lack of situational awareness.
Quickly reacts to the thanator's attack by bolting and using the environment to evade the predator.

Uses quick reflexes and agility to evade a deadly predator, including diving under roots, rolling to avoid attacks, unlatching his backpack to escape the creature's grip, and diving into a river to evade pursuit.
Fires his AR point blank at the thanator but the rifle is snatched away, indicating a momentary failure to maintain control of his weapon.
Struggles to survive after being swept over the falls, showing resilience and determination.
Grabs a limb on a fallen tree after being swept over the falls and pulls himself up despite being weak and gasping for breath.
Hacks manically at a sapling to form a crude but sharp spear tip, showing resourcefulness and survival skills.
Walks through the forest hyper-alert and cautious, holding his spear tightly, indicating awareness and carefulness.
Fails to notice Neytiri aiming an arrow at his throat from just two meters above him, showing a lapse in situational awareness.
Knots his T-shirt around the butt end of the spear, preparing a makeshift weapon or tool in response to being stalked by viperwolves.
Is unaware of the arrow aimed at his throat by Neytiri, indicating a moment of vulnerability or lack of situational awareness.
Defends himself against viperwolves using torch and spear, showing quick thinking and courage.
Fights fiercely to defend himself against attacking wolves, showing determination and resilience.
Cracks spear down on one attacker and plants spear in another, striking true.
Loses grip of spear and torch, left in semi-darkness.
Draws knife quickly and slashes wolf attacking his arm, cutting deep and making it release.
Sprints and scrambles to escape multiple attackers, showing agility and persistence.
Barely catches wolf's throat to keep jaws away from his face, preventing serious injury.
Pins and chokes the attacking wolf to protect himself and others.
Expresses gratitude to Neytiri for her help and says 'I owe you.'
Attempts to stop Neytiri from extinguishing the torch, showing concern for the environment and situation.
Pins and chokes a wolf with all his weight, preventing it from attacking him further.
Scrambles to recover his spear after the torch is extinguished, showing alertness and readiness.
Attempts to communicate gratitude to Neytiri despite cultural and language barriers.
Does not prevent Neytiri from extinguishing the torch despite his initial protest, showing some hesitation or lack of control over the situation.
Thanks Neytiri for killing the viperwolves, tries to show gratitude despite tension.
Grasps Neytiri's shoulder impulsively, causing her to react violently.
Apologizes sincerely after Neytiri expresses anger and blames him.
Engages Neytiri in conversation, trying to understand her perspective despite conflict.
Thanks Neytiri for killing the viperwolves, showing gratitude and social awareness.
Grasps Neytiri's shoulder impulsively, provoking a violent reaction.
Tries to explain himself calmly after being struck, showing emotional control.
Questions Neytiri's reasoning and challenges her accusations, demonstrating assertiveness and critical thinking.
Gets up slowly and faces Neytiri after being attacked, showing resilience and courage.
Goes after Neytiri when she turns away, tries to engage and learn from her despite her harsh words.
Admits ignorance and asks to be taught to 'See,' showing humility and openness.
Accidentally drops spear and almost falls, but does not react with anger or blame, allowing Neytiri to help him.
Follows Neytiri through difficult terrain, keeps up with her jogging pace, and manages to not fall despite surprise at the height.
Asks to be taught and shows willingness to learn despite being called ignorant.
Loses balance when a vine catches his spear and almost falls off the root, dropping his spear.
Asks Neytiri for help and to take him with her despite her initial refusal.
Holds still and accepts the woodsprites landing on him without fear, showing openness and trust.
Expresses wonder and curiosity about the woodsprites and the environment, showing sincere engagement.
Asks for help clearly and directly, shows openness to new experiences by calmly accepting the woodsprites and studying them carefully.
Appears confused and asks 'What was that all about?' after the woodsprites leave, indicating some lack of understanding.
Asks Neytiri her name, showing curiosity and openness.
Untangles himself after being caught in the bolo and gets up to run, showing resilience but no aggressive or hostile behavior.
Snaps a look quickly when a bolo flies at him, showing alertness.
Gets tangled by the bolo and topples off the root, indicating a momentary lack of physical control or situational awareness.
Untangles himself and gets up quickly to run, showing resilience and ability to recover.
Turns to bolt when confronted by armed Na'vi riders, showing instinct for self-preservation but possibly lack of strategic thinking in a hostile situation.
Is hauled roughly and force-marched by the Na'vi, showing no resistance or panic.
Steps forward and offers his hand to Eytukan despite the tense situation and risk of hostility.
Shows polite respect by addressing Eytukan as 'sir' even when threatened.
Steps forward to greet Eytukan respectfully despite the tense situation, offering his hand in greeting.
Appears confused and asks 'What's going on?' and 'Who's Eywa?'
Responds honestly to Mo'at's questions, admits he is not a scientist and came to learn.
Shows vulnerability by admitting his 'cup is empty' and willingness to be taught.
Asks what others are saying, showing openness and engagement.
Responds clearly and honestly to Mo'at's questions, showing openness and willingness to learn.
Admits he is not a scientist and acknowledges his background as a Marine warrior, demonstrating self-awareness.
Appears confused about what others are saying, asking for clarification.
Does not resist or argue when Neytiri is assigned to teach him, showing acceptance of the situation.
Smiles in response to Neytiri baiting him, showing good-natured tolerance and friendliness.
Tells the clan not to get up when he enters, asserting himself but not rudely.
Engages patiently with Neytiri to learn her name, showing sincere interest.
Smiles in response to Neytiri baiting him, showing social awareness and confidence.
Asks Neytiri to repeat her name slowly to understand better, demonstrating patience and willingness to learn.
Tells the clan not to get up when he enters, showing some confidence and assertiveness.
Attempts casual conversation with Neytiri despite her clear discomfort and warning to not speak, indicating possible social naivety or lack of tact.
Accepts Neytiri's challenge to eat teylu and responds with enthusiasm and a compliment, comparing it to grandma's teylu.
Meets Neytiri's challenge by taking more teylu and eating it enthusiastically, showing willingness to engage and adapt.
Lies awake in the hammock, observing and reflecting quietly, showing awareness and internal processing.
Appears disoriented and is slapped by Grace to bring him back to reality after being in the Link, indicating some difficulty in managing the transition.
Grins and shares his experience openly with Grace and others, showing a friendly and approachable demeanor.
Responds to Quaritch with a grin and confidence, indicating a positive and sincere attitude.
Successfully gains the trust of the Omaticaya, impressing others with his natural ability.
Confidently reports to superiors and explains his situation with a grin, showing self-assurance.
Expresses concern about the indigenous people needing to relocate and asks if Augustine knows about it.
Acknowledges the responsibility given to him and commits to the task ('I'm on it').
Shows interest in learning about the clan members and their culture by naming them and asking about Eywa.
Grins at the little girl who laughs and runs back to her playmates.
Makes a teasing comment about having a date with the chief's daughter.
Hauls himself from wheelchair to Link, showing physical determination and adaptability.
Grins confidently when approached by Neytiri, indicating social ease and confidence.
Mounts the mare clumsily and nervously, showing lack of skill and confidence in riding.
Tries repeatedly to learn to ride the horse despite falling and getting muddy.
Responds to Tsu'tey's disdain with a light, humorous comment about his English.
Explains Hometree's inner structure clearly and cooperates with military officers.
Listens and prepares to work with Grace and Norm on scientific mission.
Explains the complex structure of Hometree clearly and confidently to military officers and engineers.
Responds promptly and appropriately to Quaritch's request for accurate scans.
Leans forward to get a better look at the Hallelujah Mountains, showing curiosity and engagement.
Stares in amazement, both awe-inspired and disturbed, indicating emotional reaction but no immediate action or control.
Stops to look at pictures of Grace with children and Neytiri, showing interest in others' lives.
Responds to Norm's glare with a casual 'Hey. You got a problem?'
Admits he does not understand the maglev effect and superconductors, showing awareness of his own knowledge limits.
Engages with the team and prepares for the link operation despite being new and inexperienced.
Responds to Norm's hostility with a casual 'Hey. You got a problem?', showing some confidence but possibly lacking diplomacy.
Tries to keep up with Neytiri and follows her lead patiently.
Climbs the last section of the tree, arriving out of breath but keeps up with Neytiri.
Expresses amazement at the mountain banshee but follows Neytiri's lead without hesitation.
Ducks instinctively during Neytiri's swooping flyby, showing attentiveness and respect.
Expresses tiredness and reluctance about video-logging but complies, showing sincerity and openness.
Engages in language learning with Neytiri, showing willingness to connect and respect for her culture.
Responds to Neytiri's rough corrections without complaint, showing tolerance and willingness to learn.
Mentally calls himself a 'retard' and assumes others think the same, indicating self-deprecation but also a lack of self-trust.
Interacts with Norm in a friendly, patient manner while teaching him language, showing friendliness and sincerity.
Mentally judges Norm as thinking he is a 'retard' too, showing some insecurity but no hostility.
Trusts his body and Neytiri enough to follow her in a dangerous leap of faith, showing trust and openness.
Follows Neytiri in a dangerous leap of faith, showing trust and willingness to connect.
Thinks fondly of Grace and appreciates her kindness, noting she makes him coffee before link every morning.
Learns from Neytiri by attentively observing and respecting the natural environment and her teachings.
Follows Neytiri in a dangerous leap of faith, successfully landing and surviving.
Thinks reflectively about Grace and his relationships, indicating thoughtful consideration.
Successfully negotiates with Mo'at to allow Norm and Grace a hall pass, showing social skill and confidence.
Learns to read trails, tracks, scents, and sounds, demonstrating active learning and skill acquisition.
Relaxes his bow instead of killing the hexapede, respecting the forest's permission.
Smirks and jokes about 'treehugger shit' in a somewhat dismissive way.
Creeps quietly and stalks a large male hexapede with skill, nocks an arrow expertly, tracks the target, then relaxes his arm showing patience and control.
Admits internally that he sometimes has no idea what Neytiri is talking about, showing some confusion or lack of understanding.
Acknowledges that he is still not allowed to make a kill because the forest hasn't given permission, indicating respect for local customs but also a limitation in his current skill or status.
Smirks and jokes about hoping the 'treehugger shit' isn't on the final, showing a casual or dismissive attitude toward the spiritual or cultural lessons he is supposed to learn.
Asserts ownership of his video-log politely.
Moves gracefully and silently with Neytiri, sharing a peaceful moment in the forest.
Holds up the fish triumphantly after bow-fishing, sharing a moment of success.
Maintains eye contact with Neytiri after her gentle touch, showing openness and connection.
Follows Neytiri's lead cautiously and respectfully in the clearing, showing trust and attentiveness.
Successfully drills a fish with a bow and holds it up triumphantly.
Moves gracefully and soundlessly through the night forest, adapting to the environment.
Allows his focus to be broken by Neytiri's touch while drawing his bow.
Shows curiosity and engagement by exploring the forest and reacting to the fan lizard.
Appears disoriented and weak when waking inside the link, not knowing where he is.
Speaks haltingly but with feeling in Na'vi, showing respect to the animal he killed and acknowledging its spirit.
Takes the cigarette out of Grace's mouth and stubs it out, showing concern for her health.
Responds dismissively to Grace's concern about his health, showing reluctance to accept help or care.
Silently draws his bow with intense concentration and makes a clean kill, speaking in Na'vi with feeling, showing skill and cultural understanding.
Acknowledges his physical decline and exhaustion but continues to push himself without taking care of his body, ignoring advice from Grace.
Keeps up with the teenage hunters and follows Tsu'tey's lead without complaint or hesitation.
Shrugs and leaps to a passing vine, his feet dangling over nothingness, showing confidence and physical skill in a dangerous situation.
Looks directly into the banshee's eyes and confidently approaches it, showing courage and determination.
Responds to Neytiri's hand squeeze with a rush of emotion but does not acknowledge it further, showing some emotional restraint or awkwardness.
Approaches the banshee confidently, looks it in the eyes, and initiates the challenge with 'Let's dance.'
Successfully uses the bolo to disable the banshee's jaws and avoids its attack by timing the lunge and slipping aside.
Leaps over the banshee's talons and tackles it effectively, showing physical skill and quick reflexes.
Asks Neytiri how to know if the banshee chooses him, showing some uncertainty.
Calms the banshee by commanding it to be quiet and fly straight during a dangerous flight.
Leaps at the banshee, wrestles it to the ground, and successfully bonds with it despite being injured and nearly falling off a cliff.
Commands the banshee to be quiet and fly straight, demonstrating control and quick thinking under pressure.
Follows Neytiri's lead in flight despite initial clumsiness, showing willingness to learn and trust.
Expresses joy and enthusiasm openly while flying with Neytiri.
Playfully pulls back meat from his banshee and strokes its head while teaching it to eat slowly.
Engages in playful chase with Neytiri among the clouds.
Shares knowledge about the Leonopteryx and its Na'vi name, 'Toruk', engaging with others in a friendly, informative way.
Stops Grace on an image to point out the Well of Souls, showing interest and collaboration.
Works fast to download Grace's images without explicit permission, potentially indicating secrecy or disregard for rules.
Correctly identifies the Great Leonopteryx as 'Toruk' and understands its significance.
Stops Grace on a specific image, recognizing the sacred site 'Vitraya Ramunong' (The Well of Souls).
Works fast to download important images onto a memory chip while under pressure.
Hesitates before handing over the memory chip, torn by what he is doing.
Greets Grace and Norm warmly with 'Hey, guys.'
Accepts the kava bowl from Tsu'tey and drinks heartily, engaging in the communal ritual despite the challenge.
Shares a moment of mutual respect and humor with Tsu'tey, responding to a teasing insult with a simple apology.
Kills the beast with a precise arrow shot to a vulnerable spot.
Acts out the leonopteryx attack confidently among young hunters, showing leadership and knowledge.
Accepts the kava bowl from Tsu'tey and drinks heartily despite warnings, showing social confidence and willingness to engage.
Responds to Tsu'tey's insult with a simple 'Sorry' without escalating conflict, showing emotional intelligence and social tact.
Joins the circle of dancers, lets himself go dancing from the inside, channeling primal energy, and connects deeply with Neytiri.
Lets the drums and chanting flow through him, dances from the inside, channeling primal energy, showing confidence and ability to adapt to unfamiliar cultural practices.
Protests when pulled to dance but ultimately participates fully, indicating initial hesitation but eventual engagement.
Reflects on the deep connection the People have to the forest and their respect for the cycle of life and energy.
Observes the burial ritual with reverence and sensitivity.
Expresses confusion and loss of identity in a sincere and vulnerable video log.
Pushes the lid off the Link pod and emerges despite looking pale and haggard, showing physical and mental endurance.
Records video logs late at night, reflecting on his identity and mental state, indicating self-awareness and introspection.
Appears physically deteriorated and mentally strained, looking like a junkie and unsure of who he is anymore.
Responds to Selfridge's question with a bit of impatience, pushing for a direct answer.
Shows determination and sincerity when he insists he can continue the mission despite doubts.
Responds to Selfridge's question with a direct, confident offer to report progress.
Grace states Jake is making incredible progress, years worth in just a few months.
Jake cannot meet Quaritch's eyes, showing some internal doubt or discomfort.
Jake asserts firmly to Quaritch that he can do this despite doubts and pressure.
Feels hollow inside, knowing what he's done.
Determined to complete the Dream Hunt to gain trust and negotiate terms for relocation.
Pushes past Grace despite her concerns and warnings.
Confidently insists on completing the Dream Hunt despite warnings and physical strain.
Feels hollow inside knowing what he's done, showing internal conflict.
Pushes past Grace's warnings about the dangers of the vision quest and psychoactive alkaloids, ignoring expert advice.
Admits to being sent to deceive the Omaticaya and struggle with his divided loyalties.
Expresses fear of losing connection with the Omaticaya and the woman he cares about if he reveals the truth.
Pulls himself from his wheelchair and hauls his useless legs into the Link, showing physical determination and readiness to engage.
Admits to Norm and Grace that he was sent by Quaritch to deceive the Omaticaya, showing honesty and self-awareness.
Expresses internal conflict and confusion about his identity and loyalties, appearing lost and hopeless.
Acknowledges the risks of telling the truth to either Quaritch or the Omaticaya, showing strategic thinking about consequences.
Shows vulnerability and pleads with Grace, revealing emotional openness and trust.
Smiles wanly and accepts the burden of the Dream Hunt, showing resilience but also a quiet acceptance without complaint.
Engages respectfully in the Na'vi ritual, allowing himself to be purified and prepared by Mo'at and elders.
Acknowledges the emotional and cultural weight of the Dream Hunt and prepares himself mentally and physically by sitting calmly and allowing the ritual painting and purification to proceed.
Expresses vulnerability and emotional conflict openly, showing he is lost and torn between worlds.
Pleading to leave and showing signs of emotional strain, indicating some difficulty coping with the burden he carries.
Endures a painful and intense ritual involving a stinging arachnoid and consuming a glowing worm without complaint.
Participates fully and obediently in the ritual, enduring pain and discomfort without hesitation.
Experiences intense physical and sensory disorientation during the vision, but remains conscious and aware.
Vomits after the ritual, showing physical vulnerability and lack of immediate control over his body.
Endures intense physical agony and a harrowing vision without giving up, ultimately completing a difficult spiritual trial.
Appears weak and disoriented immediately after the trial, gasping and rolling up slowly, showing physical vulnerability.
Accepts Eytukan's gesture of placing hands on his chest and embraces the clan's physical connection by allowing many clan members to touch him, symbolizing acceptance and unity.
Looks up at the Leonopteryx Skull Totem with a sense of awe and responsibility, showing respect for the clan's culture and values.
Stands weakly when motioned by Eytukan, showing some physical frailty but still complies with the ritual.
Receives the clans acceptance and connection, indicating social competence and trust earned.
Looks up at the Leonopteryx Skull Totem, showing awareness of cultural symbols and significance.
Seems troubled and unsure how to communicate his experience to the clan elders.
Interacts gently with the willow tendrils, showing appreciation for the sacred place.
Rejects other women suggested by Neytiri, but does so respectfully and sincerely.
Stops Neytiri from continuing to name other women, indicating clear and honest communication about his feelings.
Expresses that the woman he chooses must also choose him, showing respect for mutual consent.
Shares an intimate moment with Neytiri, showing openness and affection.
Interacts respectfully and attentively with the Na'vi customs, showing understanding and confidence in his new role as Omaticaya.
Interrupts Neytiri gently to assert his choice of partner, demonstrating clear communication and decisiveness.
Strokes Neytiri's face tenderly after intimacy.
Responds with openness and acceptance to Neytiri's declaration of being mated for life.
Engages in intimate bonding with Neytiri, showing emotional openness and attentiveness.
Shows some uncertainty about the cultural significance of mating, needing Neytiri to explain it.
Accepts and embraces Neytiri's declaration of mating for life with calm consideration.
Lies quietly in Neytiri's arms, allowing himself to be comforted and sheltered.
Responds to Grace's teasing with a sigh and eats the food she offers, showing tolerance and acceptance.
Jake is in a hurry to get back to the link and eats quickly to regain strength, showing focus and readiness to act.
Lies awake thinking in his coffin, seemingly passive and disconnected from immediate danger.
Runs into the path of the bulldozer, waving his arms to stop it and protect the forest.
Pushes Grace's hands away and pulls the lid down when she comments on his hygiene.
Runs into the path of the bulldozer, waving his arms to stop it, positioning himself to be seen by the operator.
Tries to physically stop the bulldozer by climbing onto it and smashing the camera lens with a rock.
Stumbles and nearly gets caught under the bulldozer blade.
Dives off the dozer to protect Neytiri and hides with her from the attack on the forest.
Dives off the dozer under fire, grabs Neytiri, and takes cover effectively.
His snarling face is captured on camera, indicating intense engagement and possibly loss of composure.
Takes Neytiri's arm gently to stop her and prepare to share difficult news, showing care and consideration.
Reaches out for Neytiri after being attacked, seeking connection and support.
Takes Neytiri's arm to stop her and tries to prepare her for difficult news, showing initiative and calm in a tense situation.
Is physically overpowered and toppled by Tsu'tey's unexpected attack, indicating a momentary lack of physical preparedness or anticipation.
Stands up quickly after being knocked down and reaches out to Neytiri, showing resilience and emotional steadiness.
Accepts Tsu'tey's challenge to fight, despite the tension.
Blocks and elbows Tsu'tey hard in the face during the fight.
Sidesteps and blocks Tsu'tey's knife attack, then elbows him hard in the face, showing readiness and effective defense.
Accepts Tsu'tey's challenge confidently despite the tension, demonstrating decisiveness and confidence.
Engages in a staff fight with Tsu'tey, parrying and responding to attacks with skill and agility.
Fights Tsu'tey fiercely and with determination, showing commitment and respect in combat.
Expresses fury and confronts Quaritch aggressively after Quaritch disrupts Grace's link, showing protective instincts.
Does not retaliate physically after being punched and restrained by troopers, showing restraint.
Rolls out of a sweep and counters with a hit to Tsu'tey's belly.
Presses hard in the fight, lands a solid hit dropping Tsu'tey to his knees.
Eyes go blank and he becomes inert after Grace's link is cut, allowing Tsu'tey to strike him down.
Slams open the Link angrily and confronts Quaritch, showing emotional but impulsive behavior.
Defiantly meets Quaritch's gaze, supports Grace's attempt to de-escalate conflict, urges Quaritch to listen to her for the sake of keeping people alive.
Meets Quaritch's glare with a defiant glare, stands his ground calmly despite being bruised and bleeding.
Pounds a rock into the dozer camera lens with his avatar, showing aggressive but focused behavior.
Allows himself to be zip-tied and captured without apparent resistance or escape attempt.
Intervenes verbally to urge Quaritch to listen to Grace, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Encourages Grace to communicate her knowledge simply and confidently to Parker.
Expresses deep understanding and empathy for the Na'vi, acknowledging their perspective and the horror they feel towards humans.
Speaks in a late-night monologue, appearing haggard and borderline deranged, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
His words are used by Quaritch to condemn the Na'vi, causing Jake visible dread and discomfort.
Records a late-night monologue expressing his understanding of the Na'vi perspective and the futility of negotiation, showing insight and self-awareness.
His recorded words are used against him by Quaritch to undermine him and the Avatar program, indicating a failure to anticipate consequences of his candidness.
Acknowledges the manipulation behind the conflict, showing awareness of injustice.
Responds quickly and with urgency to the threat against Hometree, indicating concern for others.
Recognizes and articulates the manipulative strategy behind the conflict, showing understanding of the situation.
Responds quickly and decisively to urgent news about the attack on Hometree by immediately moving to act.
Tries to prevent violence by offering to talk the Na'vi out of conflict, emphasizing their trust in him.
Speaks sincerely and clearly to the Na'vi clan in their own language, warning them of danger and urging them to evacuate to save lives.
Admits to Neytiri that he fell in love with the forest, the Omaticaya People, and her, showing sincerity and emotional openness.
Does not resist when bound by the Omaticaya hunters, indicating acceptance and non-aggression.
Initially follows orders that betray the Omaticaya, causing pain and distrust.
Admits to Neytiri that he knew the attack would happen but was conflicted due to his love for the Omaticaya and her, showing emotional honesty and internal conflict.
Does not resist when captured and bound by the Omaticaya hunters, showing restraint but also a lack of immediate tactical response.
Yells to Neytiri, Tsu'tey, and others to get out of Hometree, begging them to run to the forest to escape danger.
Yells to Neytiri, Tsu'tey, and others to get out of Hometree and run to the forest, urgently trying to save lives.
Mo'at frees Jake from his bindings, showing faith in him; Jake takes the knife and cuts Grace free, then urges immediate escape to save lives.
Struggles with his bindings but remains focused and accepts Mo'at's help to free himself and Grace, then quickly acts to cut Grace free and urges immediate escape.
Searches for Neytiri amid the chaos and firestorm, showing concern and presence of mind.
Kneels next to Neytiri and apologizes after she pushes him away in grief.
Staggers lost and alone through the burning forest, utterly shattered and vacant-eyed.
Reels out of the smoke, kneels next to Neytiri, apologizes, but is rejected and emotionally shattered, staggering lost and alone through the burning forest.
Thanks Max and Trudy for their help in the escape.
Faces his group with determination and invites them to start a revolution together.
Wheels out of the cell, grabs a sidearm from a fallen trooper, chambers a round, and confidently rallies the group for a revolution.
Thanks his rescuers calmly and takes initiative immediately after being freed.
Tells Max 'I need somebody on the inside I can trust' and grips his hand tightly.
Calmly orders the trooper to get on the ground and comply, preventing escalation.
Commands Trudy to get her ship fired up and assigns Max to stay inside, showing leadership and trust in his team.
Confronts an armed trooper calmly, disarms the situation by ordering the trooper to comply, demonstrating control and tactical skill.
Moves quickly from confrontation to extraction, coordinating the team to get him and others safely into the chopper and escape.
Pumps his fist exultantly after the ship lifts off under fire.
Looks at Grace and freezes when he sees her injured and bleeding.
Tells Grace to 'Hang on' showing concern for her wellbeing.
Yanks stuff out of the trauma bag to help Grace who is injured and in shock.
Pumps fist in celebration after escaping gunfire, showing confidence.
Immediately shifts to helping Grace with her injury, yanking out trauma supplies and instructing her to hang on.
Engages in quick decision-making to head toward the Well of Souls despite difficult conditions and limited instrumentation.
Gives Grace an ampule of morphine for the pain and insists on getting her help despite her refusal.
Gives Grace an ampule of morphine for the pain and insists on getting her help despite her resistance.
Knows the People would go to the Well of Souls, showing understanding of their culture and behavior.
Feels Grace's cold forehead, showing concern for her condition.
Determines to try to reach a place despite danger, showing commitment and sincerity.
Strokes his bonded banshee's head, showing affection and connection.
Calmly rides the feared Toruk into the midst of the paralyzed Na'vi, then dismounts and gently strokes the animal's flank, inspiring awe and hope among the Omaticaya.
Successfully tames and rides the legendary Toruk, demonstrating mastery and calmness amid a fearful crowd.
Approaches the Na'vi crowd confidently after riding Toruk, inspiring awe and hope.
Looks into Neytiri's eyes and shares a powerful, sincere moment with her.
Takes Neytiri's hand and climbs the dais, showing connection and trust.
Publicly acknowledges Tsu'tey's status and asks for his support sincerely.
Expresses readiness to serve the people and includes others in leadership.
Carries Grace's human body gently, showing care and tenderness.
Speaks to Grace with warmth and concern as she awakens.
Addresses the crowd confidently, acknowledges Tsu'tey's leadership, and seeks his support, showing diplomatic skill and leadership.
Carries Grace's human body carefully and respectfully, showing physical capability and emotional composure under pressure.
Begging the help of the Great Mother for Grace's survival, demonstrating humility and strategic awareness of cultural/spiritual protocols.
Realizes the gravity of Mo'at's suggestion about Grace's avatar, indicating perceptiveness and thoughtful consideration.
Kneels next to Grace, takes her hand, comforts her with reassuring words.
Feels emotional and sincere when Grace expresses pride and gives him a charge to help others.
Kneels next to Grace, holds her hand, offers reassurance despite the gravity of the situation.
Promises to help and do whatever it takes after Grace's urging, showing commitment and resolve.
Feels emotional and chokes up, showing vulnerability but does not freeze or fail to act.
Calls out in grief at Grace's death, shows deep emotional pain.
Seeks permission to speak and asks for honor to translate, showing respect and humility.
Speaks passionately to rally the clans against a common threat, demonstrating leadership and concern for others.
Despite personal grief, he composes himself and takes initiative to speak before the clan, rallying them to action with passion and clarity.
Looks hopefully toward Grace's avatar after her death, showing a moment of denial or unrealistic hope.
Takes Neytiri's hand and runs to the leonopteryx, allowing her to join him on the ride.
Leads a large group of riders to rally multiple clans successfully, demonstrating leadership and strategic coordination.
Confidently mounts and rides a leonopteryx into battle, showing skill and bravery.
Speaks before another clan and effectively communicates through Neytiri, facilitating alliance-building.
Watches his army gathering next to the Leonopteryx, showing calm observation and leadership presence before battle.
Suggests talking to Selfridge to cut a deal and prevent escalation.
Quickly assesses the situation and attempts to negotiate by suggesting to Max to talk to Selfridge to cut a deal before the conflict escalates.
Acknowledges his role in enabling the enemy's plan and expresses determination to stop it.
Shows physical and emotional strain but continues to push forward.
Teaches the Na'vi about the Scorpion gunship using a drawn totem, engaging them eagerly.
Responds tersely to Trudy's concern about their chances, with a blunt 'What's your point?'
Speaks sincerely and vulnerably to the Mother Tree, expressing concern for the Na'vi and warning of future threats.
Draws a strategic plan on the animal skin to instruct the Na'vi on attacking the Scorpion gunship rotors, effectively teaching them a complex tactic.
Acknowledges the low chances of success against gunships with bows and arrows but does not show defeatism, maintaining focus.
Approaches the Mother Tree with humility and openness, admitting inexperience but still attempting a spiritual communication to warn and prepare.
Speaks to the tree about the threat of the Sky People and the destruction they bring, showing awareness and concern but no clear plan beyond warning.
Admits he could use a little help and stands ready to fight for the cause chosen for him.
Attempts to connect with Neytiri by physical closeness and shared moment of peace.
Acknowledges the need to fight and asks for help, showing awareness of his limits and willingness to collaborate.
Expresses determination to stand and fight when chosen for a role, demonstrating confidence and commitment.
Attempts to persuade Neytiri by appealing to her beliefs, showing strategic thinking even if unsuccessful.
Accepts rejection with a lighthearted comment ('It was worth a try'), indicating emotional intelligence and resilience.
Rushes straight down, screaming a war cry as he leads the charge on his banshee.
Leads a daring aerial charge, successfully attacks and causes a gunship to crash, evading enemy fire skillfully.
Kicks the gunship loose from the leonopteryx, causing it to crash and explode, effectively neutralizing a threat.
Communicates clearly and decisively with Tsu'tey, stating 'We have to stop the shuttles, no matter what it takes.'
Rolls in after Tsu'tey to join the attack but is forced to evade a gunship dropping in behind him.
Expresses excitement and encouragement as he realizes Eywa is aiding in the battle, shouting 'WHOO-HOOOO!'
Observes the battle and quickly realizes that Eywa is intervening by sending wild banshees to attack the enemy ships.
Expresses surprise initially with 'What the hell -- ?' but then shows excitement and understanding with 'WHOO-HOOOO!'
Leads a formation of hunters to attack the besieged shuttle, actively engaging in battle to protect allies.
Uses grenades and aggressive tactics in combat, showing determination but also ruthlessness.
Signals a formation of hunters to attack the besieged shuttle, coordinating an aerial assault.
Swoops down on his leonopteryx, rolls off and lands on the shuttle while under fire, showing physical skill and bravery.
Rakes gunners with his assault rifle while advancing, maintaining offensive pressure.
Pulls two grenades from his battle harness and yanks the pins out with his teeth, preparing for a tactical explosive attack.
Throws grenades to disable enemy shuttle engines, risking his own safety to stop the threat.
Throws grenades accurately into the VTOL turbofan intakes, causing critical damage and disabling the shuttle.
Leaps into space and reconnects with his Leonopteryx mount mid-action, then escapes successfully.
Successfully mounts and jumps onto the hull of the Dragon mid-flight, quickly regaining footing and running.
Yanks two grenades, pulls pins with his teeth, and throws them to damage the ship despite personal risk.
Warns others via headset about Quaritch's attack and urges them to defend the Well of Souls.
Yanks two grenades, pulls pins with his teeth, and throws them at the turbine intakes, causing a large hole in the hull despite being flung off his feet.
Maintains presence of mind after being shot at and falling off the ship, uses learned skills to break his fall with leaves, lands unhurt.
Immediately communicates critical tactical information over headset, directing allies to target Quaritch.
Is oblivious under the link while Quaritch approaches the shack, showing lack of situational awareness.
Drops from a tree limb to confront Quaritch and attempts to rescue Neytiri by engaging in combat.
Drops from a tree limb to confront Quaritch, showing initiative and confidence.
Parries Quaritch's knife slashes with a broken cannon, demonstrating skill and quick reflexes.
Closes distance faster than the suit can move and repeatedly attacks, showing tactical aggression and capability.
Ducks and rolls to avoid attacks and stomps, showing agility and situational awareness.
Leaps forward to smash the canopy repeatedly, using the environment effectively in combat.
Hits Quaritch in a flying tackle to protect the Link and Neytiri.
Reaches around the suit, yanks Quaritch's shoulder, smashing his face into the cockpit edge to stop him.
Neytiri saves Jake by putting a breathing mask on him when he is near unconsciousness.
Touches Neytiri's face gently and shares a silent, sincere moment with her.
Kneels beside the mortally wounded Tsu'tey and reassures him that the people are safe.
Draws and releases an arrow smoothly, successfully killing Quaritch.
Despite being on the edge of unconsciousness, scrambles toward an emergency breathing mask showing presence of mind and physical effort.
Touches Neytiri's face and meets her eyes, showing emotional awareness but no direct competence indicator.
Kneels beside mortally wounded Tsu'tey and communicates clearly, showing leadership and calm under pressure.
Reluctantly accepts leadership role despite self-doubt.
Shows compassion by ending Tsu'tey's suffering and reciting prayer with tears.
Accepts the heavy responsibility of leading the People despite his own doubts.
Shows hesitation and reluctance to kill Tsu'tey, but ultimately performs the difficult act with respect and skill.
Expresses self-doubt by saying 'I'm not officer material.'
Stands together with Neytiri watching the departure of the Sky People, showing solidarity and shared emotion.
Reflects on the healing of the forest and hearts of the People, expressing hope and care.
Records a final videolog acknowledging the efforts of the science team and his own feelings about leaving, showing sincerity and respect.
Stands calmly with Neytiri watching the departure of the Sky People, showing composure in a tense moment.
Records a final videolog reflecting thoughtfully on the healing of the forest and people, demonstrating insight and responsibility.
Acknowledges the ongoing scientific efforts to maintain the facility but emotionally detaches from it, indicating awareness of his limits and priorities.
Appears thin and pale in the link room, possibly indicating physical or emotional strain but continues to fulfill his duties.
